ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Continuing my treatment will give me additional useful perspective on my situation (issues).
Continuing my treatment will give me a better understanding of what I am going through.
Continuing my treatment will provide me with non-judgmental support.
Continuing my treatment will provide me with someone to talk to confidentially.
Continuing my treatment will provide me with help for my feelings.
Continuing my treatment will provide me with help for dealing with stress.
Continuing my treatment makes me worried they might make me do things I do not want (e.g. make me go to the hospital).
In my treatment, it is difficult to open up to my therapist.
Continuing my treatment will make me feel misunderstood rather than understood.
Continuing my treatment will not make me feel better.
Continuing my treatment will be hard because I will feel judged (i.e., they will think I am crazy).
Continuing my treatment will be hard because I will have to pay too much money.
Finding the time to continue my treatment will be difficult.
For me to continue my treatment, it would be:
Notes: 1= Very easy; 2= Moderately easy; 3= Neither easy nor difficult; 4= Somewhat difficult; 5= Very difficult

ElementDescription: If I wanted to, I could easily continue my treatment
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Moderately agree; 3= Neither agree nor disagree; 4= Moderately disagree; 5= Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: How confident are you that you can continue your treatment?
Notes: 1= Very sure; 2= Moderately sure; 3= Neither sure nor unsure; 4= Somewhat unsure; 5= Very unsure

ElementDescription: How much control do you have over whether you continue treatment?
Notes: 1= No control; 2= Little control; 3= Moderate control; 4= Complete control

ElementDescription: I feel in complete control over whether I continue my treatment.
Notes: 1= Completely false; 2= Moderately false; 3= Moderately true; 4= Completely true

ElementDescription: Whether or not I continue my treatment is completely up to me.
Notes: 1= Disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Somewhat agree; 4= Agree

ElementDescription: The number of events outside my control which could prevent me from continuing my treatment are:
Notes: 1= Numerous; 2= Somewhat numerous; 3= Somewhat few; 4= Very few
